channel.title: BUbuisnessAndMarket
channel.description: This is a randomly ordered feed of the most recent entries from BUbuisnessAndMarket, skipping any feeds with errors.

item.title: Grindr to give staff $300,000 for fertility treatments, adoption
item.description: The benefit will be available starting next year to those who have been at the company at least 18 months.

item.title: Worries about AI darling Nvidia’s future prospects may be overdone: analyst
Fraud case tied to $100 million NJ deli ends in guilty pleas
item.description: “Your Hometown Deli” became infamous when it was highlighted on Wall Street as an example of irrational exuberance in the market.

item.title: Why Ozempic maker Novo Nordisk’s stock is having its worst day since the 1980s
S&P 500 has now forfeited its post–Election Day gains — live coverage
Former Cigna insurance executive says he quit after witnessing an industry that ‘puts profits over patients’
item.description: The former VP for corporate communications at Cigna writes about the ‘crisis of conscience’ he had while working for the healthcare company.

item.title: Tesla issues massive recall spanning Cybertruck, Model 3, and Model Y over increased crash risks
item.description: Tesla is recalling almost 700,000 vehicles because of an issue with the warning light on the tire pressure monitoring system.

item.title: Nike, Carnival and FedEx shares are in the news — and on the move — early Friday
JPMorgan Chase, Bank of America, and Wells Fargo sued over Zelle scams that cost $870 million
item.description: The controversial regulator alleges the banks failed to prevent fraud on Zelle, a payment platform they co-own.

item.title: Biden pulls plug on mass student-debt cancellation
